I really am not one for writing reviews, usually I feel plenty has been said and nobody really needs my 2 cents as well. But in this case I must write - this machine is a total disappointment.
First of all, Melitta clearly has no idea what an aroma selector is. Having had two DeLonghi coffee machines before this, I am a bit used to having my coffee made more concentrated and tastier by an aroma button/selector. THIS is nothing of the sort. The coffee runs down the shoot the at the exact same speed whether you select weaker,normal or stronger. The stronger the aroma selected, the speed should slow down so that the coffee has more time to infuse before filtering down with more flavour. I am using at least 25 - 30% more ground coffee to achieve the same result of my DeLonghi machine.
The other thing is that within two months, the stop drip function totally failed so that when the coffee pot is removed, there is a steady drip of coffee out of the filter on to the hot plate.
Rarely have I been so disappointed with a purchase. If you like coffee and value a good coffee machine, don't buy this one. I will put this one down to having learned my lesson and dump it. And buy a machine that's worth having.

The machine is easy to set up and use. It makes coffee quickly and keeps it very hot, which was important for me. The machine is pre-set to keep coffee hot for 40 minutes, but you can easily change the setting to 20 or 60 minutes, and if it goes off before you're ready you can switch it on again immediately. The machine looks really good and the pot is a lovely shape and pours without dripping. The pot, lid and swivel filter case can go in the dishwasher, another plus point for me. The only reason I have not given it five stars is because I like strong coffee and to start off, I thought the coffee was a bit weak. Now, I put an extra spoonful in the filter and am happy with the result. I do think the paper filters give a better, more mellow flavour than the mesh filter on my old machine. Overall, I am pleased with the Melitta machine, I think it's good value for money, and I would recommend it.
